Sentencas: In order to understand the hydrogen oxidation reaction (HOR) mechanism in real Ni/YSZ porous anodes, the electrochemical properties as a function of hydrogen partial pressure p(H-2) and water vapor pressure p(H2O) (dry, 1% - 60% humidity) at 973 K of a commercial anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) were measured.
Titulo: Dependence of hydrogen oxidation reaction on water vapor in anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The impedance spectra from electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) measurement were analyzed by 1-D approximation transmission line model (TLM) to observe changes in the reaction resistance (r(P)) between the Ni/YSZ and reaction capacitance (C-p) from the anode.
Titulo: Dependence of hydrogen oxidation reaction on water vapor in anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: From the analysis, r(p) is essentially independent over p(H-2) in dry atmosphere but decreased with increasing p(H2O) at the anode side.
Titulo: Dependence of hydrogen oxidation reaction on water vapor in anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In contrast, the r(p) shows a large dependency on p(H-2) in wet atmosphere indicating that the rate-limiting step of HOR is probably different between dry and wet atmospheres.
Titulo: Dependence of hydrogen oxidation reaction on water vapor in anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: On the other hand, the C-p is independent of p(H-2) in dry and wet condition.
Titulo: Dependence of hydrogen oxidation reaction on water vapor in anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, similar to r(p), it has strong dependency on p(H2O).
Titulo: Dependence of hydrogen oxidation reaction on water vapor in anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: From these results, the difference in HOR between dry and wet atmospheres is assumed to be an additional reaction pathway formed in the latter where the formation of OHad- on the Ni metal surface possibly enhanced the HOR rate.
Titulo: Dependence of hydrogen oxidation reaction on water vapor in anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells
